bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 211 (Tuesday, December 7, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. MILLER of West Virginia:H.R. 6161.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8[Page H7262]

item.title: Employee Retention Tax Credit Reinstatement Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

summary.text:
Employee Retention Tax Credit Reinstatement Act

This bill provides for a reinstatement of the employee retention tax credit through 2021. The credit was established to compensate employers whose businesses were negatively impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic for wages paid to their employees.

bill.title: Employee Retention Tax Credit Reinstatement Act

item.title: Employee Retention Tax Credit Reinstatement Act
Employee Retention Tax Credit Reinstatement Act
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to temporarily reinstate the employee retention credit for employers subject to closure due to COVID-19.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
